name: Dewatered / Intermittent Segments
functionStatement: Continuous pathways for free movement of water, sediment, and organisms supporting recolonization, maintaining species diversity, and enabling recovery.
descriptionMarkdown: No artificial dryness in a historically perennial system, unless ephemeral dryness is normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Combine multi-date imagery and available flow records to identify dry segments and summarize frequency and extent.

inputs.label: Dewatered / Intermittent Segments
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: No artificial dryness and natural connectivity is maintained. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Minor dryness in small segments. / Notable dryness or disconnection in key reaches. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Chronic or large-scale dewatering causing major fragmentation. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: NAIP and Google Earth imagery time series

sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence
